quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Terms and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, country, abyssinia. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the capital and largest city of Argentina?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buenos Aires

questions.question: What is the largest landlocked country in the world in terms of area?
What is the largest country on the planet in terms of territory?
What is the name of the capital city of the Peoples Republic of China?
Which of these is true about the Commonwealth of Australia, or simply Australia?

options.text: It consists of Tasmania, Australia and several other islands.
It comprises of mainland Australia and Tasmania.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It consists of Tasmania, Australia and several other islands.

questions.question: What is the official language of India?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hindi and English

questions.question: Scotland has the lowest proportion of redheads in the world.
What is the largest country in Africa and in the Arab world in terms of area?
What country was once called Abyssinia?
The Canadian sitcom Corner Gas is set in Dog River in this province.
What is the capital of Micronesia?
Which of these South American capital cities is the farthest north?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asuncion, Paraguay

questions.question: What is the largest US state in terms of area?
What is the largest country in South America in terms of territory?
What is the largest country in the Americas in terms of territory?

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Thailand and Scotland
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: St. Luke is the patron saint of Scotland.
John Logie Baird was a Scottish engineer.
J.M. Barrie, the creator of Peanuts, was Scottish.
What is the title of the King of Thailand, Bhumipol, who started reigning in 1946?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Rama IX

questions.question: During the Vietnam War, Thailand was allied with what country?

options.text: Thailand was neutral, but favored the South Vietnamese.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The USA

questions.question: What was Thailands previous official name?

options.text: It has always been called Thailand.

questions.question: In 1767, the ancient capital of Thailand was destroyed by an army from what country?
The Tartan Army is the nickname of Scotlands national football team.
Scotlands Loch Ness is allegedly inhabited by the Loch Ness Monster.
Alexander Graham Bell was a Scottish scientist.
Name King Bhumipols wife whom he married on April 28, 1950.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Queen Sirikit

questions.question: What was the name of the old capital of Thailand, founded in 1350?
King Bhumipol of Thailand, who was educated in the west, is an accomplished jazz musician.
Haggis is the national dish of Scotland.
What is the principal religion of Thailand?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Order and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, places, ship. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: If you rent a yacht in Monte Carlo and sail to Athens, which Mediterranean islands can you visit staying on the course?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Corsica, Sardinia, Sicily, Crete

questions.question: You want to learn about the history of the Teutonic Knights, so you travel from Marienburg (present-day Malbork in Poland) to Reval (present-day Talinn) ALONG the Baltic shore. Which countries will you visit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Russia, Lithuania, Latvia, Estonia

questions.question: If you fly from Amsterdam to Tokyo, what will you you be seeing below the plane during most of the trip, if the plane takes the shortest possible path?

options.text: The ice of the Arctic Ocean
Mountain ranges (flying over Turkey, Iran, Pakistan and China)
The waters of the Atlantic and Pacific oceans

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The ice of the Arctic Ocean

questions.question: Take some warm clothes. You are traveling the Trans-Siberian railway. In which order will you pass the great Asian rivers, if you start in Moscow and travel to Vladyvostok?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Irtysh, Ob, Yenisei

questions.question: Imagine you travel with Vasco da Gama to find the sea route to India. In which order will you pass the capes of Africa?

options.text: Ras ben Sakka, Cape of Good Hope, Cape Verde
Cape Verde, Cape of Good Hope, Ras Hafun

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cape Verde, Cape of Good Hope, Ras Hafun

questions.question: If you were a Japanese fisherman sailing from north to south, in which order will you pass the main islands of your country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hokkaido, Honshu, Shikoku, Kyushu

questions.question: You are sailing around Australia. In which order will you visit Australian seaports if you sail clockwise from Sydney?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adelaide, Perth, Darwin, Brisbane

questions.question: The hot peppers used to spice Thai food are native to Thailand.
Thailand is a former colony of what country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: You are now the captain of a German boat and you take tourists down the river Danube. Which European capitals can you visit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bratislava, Vienna, Budapest, Belgrade

questions.question: You are a US Ranger patrolling the whole Mexican border. What is the order of the American states you visit if your patrol starts at the Gulf of Mexico?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Texas, New Mexico, Arizona, California

questions.question: Which of these places was chosen by Peter Jackson as the Middle Earth in The Lord of the Rings?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Zealand

questions.question: What French city is known as the “Wine Capital of Alsace”?

We move 500 years back in time. You are on a ship with Ferdinand Magellan, and you are trying to find the Western passage to India. In which order will you pass the estuaries of South American rivers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Orinoko, Amazon, La Platta

questions.question: You get on your motorbike in Chicago and travel west down the famous Route 66. Which US state will you NOT visit?

quizzes.title: History Quiz: City and Town
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, officers, peak. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Hoi An is a town in Vietnam famed for its unique lanterns.
What castle was the inspiration for Disneylands Sleeping Beauty Castle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neuschwanstein Castle

questions.question: Kyoto used to be the imperial capital of Japan.
Located in San Diego County, legally, La Jolla is recognized as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An unincorporated community

questions.question: Which Turkish town is home to the odd-looking rock formations called fairy chimneys?
On what date was the US Marine Corps founded?
Mt. Soledad, a peak overlooking La Jolla, became world-famous primarily because of what situation?

options.text: A separation-of-Religion and State battle raging over a cross at the summit
Residents trying to ban bicyclists from racing down the steep, narrow highway leading to the summit.
Hang glider enthusiasts suing for the right to launch off the peak
Illegal immigrants homesteading at the summit

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A separation-of-Religion and State battle raging over a cross at the summit

questions.question: What Portuguese town inspired Lord Byron to write the “Wanderings of Childe Harold”?
What sword do US Marine Officers carry?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mameluke Sword

questions.question: Academicians have debated the origins of La Jollas name, but it is generally accepted that the name comes from a variation of the Spanish la joya which means what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The jewel

questions.question: This territory, located between the Arctic and Atlantic Oceans, is warmed up by the magical Northern Lights.
What European city has been known as the La Dominante, Queen of the Adriatic, City of Water, City of Masks?
Californias 50th Congressional District, which includes La Jolla, is said to be the wealthiest in the nation.
What city, located in the Himalayas, is known as “The Land of Gods” .
Chesty Puller retired from the Marine Corps in 1955 as the most decorated Marine in history.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Us Navy and Wear
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, officers, females. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The maximum number of wireless communication devices authorized for wear while wearing US Navy uniform is two.
Sewn-in creases on all military shirts are optional according to US Navy regulations.
What was the location of the first US Marine amphibious assault?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Providence Island

questions.question: Enlisted US Navy women are only permitted to wear 4mm-6mm gold ball earrings.
What type of knot do US Marine officers wear atop their covers?
US Marines fought in the city of Fallujah during Operation Enduring Freedom.
According to US Navy Uniform Rules and Regulations, while wearing the service, working, and dress uniforms, all bags must be carried on the left shoulder to allow saluting.
In the US Navy men and women wear the same size rating badge on the blue working jacket.
What is the first line of the US Marine Corps hymn?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: From the halls of Montezuma...

questions.question: US Navy personnel assigned to Marine Corps units are authorized to wear Marine Corps service uniforms.
According to US Navy Uniform rules, only one ring per hand is authorized in addition to a wedding or engagement set.
According to US Navy Uniform Rules and Regulations, when a man or woman wears braids, they must be a maximum of 1/4 in. in diameter.
The US Navy issued Peacoat is authorized for wear with civilian clothing.
Were the Marines the major American force in the Pacific during World War 2?
According to US Navy regulations, a females nails should not be more than 1/4 inch past the finger tip.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Capital and Vatican City
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, country, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Cayman Islands are located in the Caribbean Sea.
Which of these British territories are located in North America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: British Virgin Islands and Anguilla

questions.question: Us Navy Airmen and Airmen Apprenctices wear red stripes on the blue and white uniforms.
Who is in charge of the Vatican City?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pope

questions.question: What is the capital of Montserrat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Plymouth(de jure), Brades(de facto)

questions.question: How is the residence of the Bishtop of Rome, the Prope, referred to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Apostolic Palace

questions.question: What is the capital of the group of four volcanic islands, known as the Pitcairn Islands?
The state of Vatican City is the smallest sovereign country in the world by which of these indicators?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both population and area

questions.question: Sudan, Ireland, New Zealand, Singapore and Australia were once part of the British Empire.
Where are the Pitcairn Islands located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in the Pacific Ocean

questions.question: New Mexico used to be a British colony.
Cyprus is a former British colony.
The British Antarctic Territory was formed in the 1960s.
This self-governing British overseas territory, located on the Iberian Peninsula, shares a border with Spain to the north.
The name of the Vatican City comes from which of the following?

options.text: A title in the Roman Catholic Church

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The name of a region
